com.epoch.mechanisms

Class MechParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.mechanisms.MechParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChemConstants, MechSynthConstants, FormatConstants, MechConstants, MechErrorConstants

    class MechParser
extends Object
implements MechConstants
    Extracts data from MRV of a response mechanism, parses and orders the stages.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int allMoleculesClassified
      Whether the mechanism's compounds could all be classified as starting materials, products, or intermediates.
      private MDocument archiveDoc
      Copy of original response (with colors removed) imported into Java; contains molecules and graphical objects.
      private List<MechArrow> arrows
      List of reaction and resonance arrows in this mechanism.
      private int firstCyclicPhysicalStageIndex
      Before stages are reordered, index of the first stage in the cyclic part of the mechanism in the list of unordered stages.
      int firstCyclicStageIndex
      After stages are reordered, logical index of the first stage in the cyclic part of the mechanism.
      private int firstStageIndex
      Before stages are reordered, index of the first logical stage of the mechanism in the list of unordered stages; not used after stages are reordered, because it will be 0.

      All of the molecules of the original response in a single Molecule.

      The number of regular reaction arrows in this mechanism.
      int numResonanceArrows
      The number of resonance arrows in this mechanism.

      List of stages that were removed by parsing; contents would have been added to a remaining stage.

      MRV representation of the original response.
      private List<MechStage> stages
      List of stages remaining in this mechanism.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void assignArrows(List<MechArrow> branchedArrows, List<MechArrow> unsureArrows)
      Classifies each graphical (straight) arrow as originating at a box, branched (originating at midpoint of another arrow), or originating in space.
      private void assignUnsureArrows(List<MechArrow> branchedArrows, List<MechArrow> unsureArrows)
      Goes through the list of arrows that originate in space (instead of at a box or the midpoint of another arrow) and assigns them to boxes or as branched arrows.
      private void checkLastStageForFlows()
      Checks whether the last stage of this linear mechanism has electron-flow arrows.
      private void copyStageContents(int sourceStageNum, int destStageNum)
      Copies the contents of one stage into another.

      private static void debugPrintMRV(Object... msg) 
      private void extractArrows()
      Get lists of reaction and resonance arrows, find the stages that they link.
      private void extractFlows()
      Get electron-flow arrows from the MDocument and put them in their correct stage.
      private void extractMolecules()
      Extract individual molecules from the imported molecule and place them in their stages, ensuring each atom of each molecule is inside the same rectangle.

      Creates a modified response with the indicated MObjects colored, throws a MechError of the appropriate type.

      A parsing error occurred because an atom was in two boxes.

      A parsing error occurred because an atom was outside any box.
      private void failFindFirstStage(List<MechStage> oneLinkStages)
      Throws an error because there are three or more stages with one link to other stages.
      private void findFirstStage()
      Finds the terminal and first cyclic stages (if any), and ensures that the number of stages with 1 or 3 linking arrows is consistent with an acceptable topology.
      private void findFirstStage(List<MechStage> oneLinkStages)
      Finds the first stage when there are two stages with one link to other stages.

      Finds the first stage when there are two stages with one link to other stages.
      private void findFirstStage(MechStage threeLinksStage)
      Finds the first stage when there are no stages with one link to other stages.
      private void findFirstStage(MechStage firstStage, MechStage threeLinksStage)
      Finds the first stage when there is one stage with one link to other stages.

      Determines whether a point lies on an arrow.

      Decides whether a resonance arrow's prevStage and nextStage are correct or should be switched.

      Starting with firstStage, follow the reaction/resonance arrow links in each stage to physically reorder the stages in logical order.

      Ungroups the molecules' shortcut groups.

    • Field Detail

      • WITHBOXINDEX

        private static final String WITHBOXINDEX
        Shorthand in bug reporting.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • respMRV

        private final transient String respMRV
        MRV representation of the original response.

      • archiveDoc

        private transient MDocument archiveDoc
        Copy of original response (with colors removed) imported into Java; contains molecules and graphical objects.

      • mechDoc

        private transient MDocument mechDoc
        Original response as imported into Java; contains molecules and graphical objects, which are extracted. It is destroyed in the parsing process; do not use afterwards!

      • importedMolecule

        private transient Molecule importedMolecule
        All of the molecules of the original response in a single Molecule. Don't use after the mechanism has been parsed!

      • mols

        private transient Molecule[] mols
        Molecules in this mechanism.

      • arrows

        private transient List<MechArrow> arrows
        List of reaction and resonance arrows in this mechanism.

      • stages

        private transient List<MechStage> stages
        List of stages remaining in this mechanism.

      • removedStages

        private transient List<MechStage> removedStages
        List of stages that were removed by parsing; contents would have been added to a remaining stage.

      • firstCyclicPhysicalStageIndex

        private transient int firstCyclicPhysicalStageIndex
        Before stages are reordered, index of the first stage in the cyclic part of the mechanism in the list of unordered stages. It has two previous stages, one of which is also in the cyclic part, the other of which is the last stage in the linear part.

      • firstCyclicStageIndex

        public transient int firstCyclicStageIndex
        After stages are reordered, logical index of the first stage in the cyclic part of the mechanism. It has two previous stages, one of which is also in the cyclic part, the other of which is the last stage in the linear part.

      • firstStageIndex

        private transient int firstStageIndex
        Before stages are reordered, index of the first logical stage of the mechanism in the list of unordered stages; not used after stages are reordered, because it will be 0.

      • numReactionArrows

        public transient int numReactionArrows
        The number of regular reaction arrows in this mechanism.

      • numResonanceArrows

        public transient int numResonanceArrows
        The number of resonance arrows in this mechanism.

      • topology

        public transient int topology
        The mechanism's topology.

      • allMoleculesClassified

        public int allMoleculesClassified
        Whether the mechanism's compounds could all be classified as starting materials, products, or intermediates. (Errors in electron-flow arrows could prevent it.)

    throws MechError,
           MolFormatException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        responseMRV - original MRV of the response
        Throws:
        MolFormatException - if molecule can't be imported
        MechError - if something goes wrong during parsing

      • setupMDoc

        private void setupMDoc()
                throws MechError,
                       MolFormatException
        Extract MDocument (contains flows, arrows, etc) and molecules from the given student response, and uncolor.
        Throws:
        MolFormatException - if molecule can't be imported
        MechError - if there are no rectangles or arrows

      • setupStages

        private void setupStages()
                  throws MechError
        Creates a stage for each rectangle found in the MDocument.
        Throws:
        MechError - if there are not at least two rectangles

      • extractMolecules

        private void extractMolecules()
                       throws MechError
        Extract individual molecules from the imported molecule and place them in their stages, ensuring each atom of each molecule is inside the same rectangle. Supergroups are contracted for purposes of determining whether or not all atoms in the group are "inside the rectangle".
        Throws:
        MechError - if there are no molecules, if an atom is outside any box, if an atom is in two boxes, if a molecule spans two rectangles, if there are valence or wedge errors

      • extractFlows

        private void extractFlows()
                   throws MechError
        Get electron-flow arrows from the MDocument and put them in their correct stage.
        Throws:
        MechError - if an electron-flow arrow connects molecules in two rectangles, if a two-electron electron-flow arrow points from an atom to one of its ligands, or if an electron-flow arrow begins at a shortcut group

      • extractArrows

        private void extractArrows()
                    throws MechError
        Get lists of reaction and resonance arrows, find the stages that they link.
        Throws:
        MechError - if a reaction/resonance arrow points to an arrow, if lines connect boxes instead of arrows, if a product-only box contains electron-flow arrows, if an arrow points to nothing, if a reaction/resonance arrow does not connect one box to one other box, if a box is linked to four or more boxes, if the tails of two arrows overlap

      • findFirstStage

        private void findFirstStage()
                     throws MechError
        Finds the terminal and first cyclic stages (if any), and ensures that the number of stages with 1 or 3 linking arrows is consistent with an acceptable topology.
        Acceptable
        topology # stages with one linking arrow # stages with three linking arrows
        lineartwonone
        cyclicnonenone
        linear + cycliconeone
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is an incorrect number of first or last stages, or if some stages have too few or too many links, or if more than one stage has three links, or if the first stage could not be identified

      • reorderStages

        private void reorderStages()
                    throws MechError
        Starting with firstStage, follow the reaction/resonance arrow links in each stage to physically reorder the stages in logical order.
        Throws:
        MechError - if the reaction/resonance arrows don't indicate a logical sequence

      • getStageOf

        private int getStageOf(MolAtom atom)
        Gets 0-based index of stage in stageList in which the given atom falls.
        Parameters:
        atom - the atom
        Returns:
        index of stage in stages in which the given atom falls; -1 for not found in a stage, -2 for found in more than one stage

      • getStageOf

        private int getStageOf(MPoint point)
        Gets 0-based index of stage with which the arrow endpoint is associated. First checks whether the arrow endpoint coincides with an MRectangle point; if not, checks whether the arrow endpoint falls within a box physically.
        Parameters:
        point - the arrow endpoint
        Returns:
        index of stage in stageList in which the given point falls; -1 for not found, -2 for found in more than one stage, or -3 if found in a stage that has been removed

      • getStageOf

        private int getStageOf(DPoint3 p,
                       boolean isArrowPoint)
        Gets 0-based index of stage in stageList in which the given point falls.
        Parameters:
        p - coordinates of point
        isArrowPoint - if point is head or tail of an arrow
        Returns:
        index of stage in stages in which the given point falls; -1 for not found in a stage, -2 for found in more than one stage

      • getStageBox

        private MRectangle getStageBox(int num)
        Gets the box of a stage.
        Parameters:
        num - the 0-based index of the stage
        Returns:
        the stage's box

      • getStageBoxIndex

        private int getStageBoxIndex(int num)
        Gets the 0-based index of the box of a stage.
        Parameters:
        num - the 0-based index of the stage
        Returns:
        the 0-based index of the stage's box

      • getIndicesByFlows

        private Map<MEFlow,int[]> getIndicesByFlows()
                                     throws MechError
        Gets the electron-flow arrows and both their indices and the indices of the boxes in which they reside.
        Returns:
        map of array of flow and box indices, keyed by electron-flow arrow
        Throws:
        MechError - if an electron-flow arrow connects molecules in two rectangles

      • setMechFlows

        private void setMechFlows(Map<MEFlow,int[]> indicesByFlows)
                   throws MechError
        Creates the MechFlows and adds them to the stages that they're in.
        Parameters:
        indicesByFlows - map of array of flow and box indices, keyed by electron-flow arrow
        Throws:
        MechError - if a two-electron electron-flow arrow points from an atom to one of its ligands, or if it points from a bond directly to an atom not in that bond, or if an electron-flow arrow begins at a shortcut group

      • ungroupShortcutGroups

        private void ungroupShortcutGroups()
        Ungroups the molecules' shortcut groups.

      • assignArrows

        private void assignArrows(List<MechArrow> branchedArrows,
                          List<MechArrow> unsureArrows)
                   throws MechError
        Classifies each graphical (straight) arrow as originating at a box, branched (originating at midpoint of another arrow), or originating in space.
        Parameters:
        branchedArrows - empty when passed; arrows found to originate at the midpoint of another arrow
        unsureArrows - empty when passed; arrows originating in space
        Throws:
        MechError - if a reaction/resonance arrow points to an arrow, if lines connect boxes instead of arrows

      • assignUnsureArrows

        private void assignUnsureArrows(List<MechArrow> branchedArrows,
                                List<MechArrow> unsureArrows)
                         throws MechError
        Goes through the list of arrows that originate in space (instead of at a box or the midpoint of another arrow) and assigns them to boxes or as branched arrows.
        Parameters:
        branchedArrows - arrows found to originate at the midpoint of another arrow
        unsureArrows - arrows originating in space
        Throws:
        MechError - if the tails of two arrows overlap

      • onArrow

        private boolean onArrow(MPoint pt,
                        MechArrow arrow)
        Determines whether a point lies on an arrow.
        Parameters:
        pt - the point
        arrow - the arrow
        Returns:
        true if the point lies on the arrow

      • mergeBoxesOfBranchedArrows

        private void mergeBoxesOfBranchedArrows(List<MechArrow> branchedArrows)
                                 throws MechError
        It's permissible for reaction arrow 1 to originate at the midpoint of reaction arrow 2 if, (1) the box to which arrow 1 points has no other arrow originating from or pointing to it, and (2) arrow 2 originates at a stage and points to a stage. We'll merge the stage to which arrow 1 points into the stage to which arrow 2 points.
        Parameters:
        branchedArrows - list of arrows branching from other arrows
        Throws:
        MechError - if a product-only box contains electron-flow arrows, if an arrow points to nothing

      • setArrowEndpoints

        private void setArrowEndpoints()
                        throws MechError
        For each reaction or resonance arrow of this stage, set the stages at which it originates and to which it points, and store all the stages. Does NOT set directionality of resonance arrows.
        Throws:
        MechError - if a reaction/resonance arrow does not connect one box to one other box, if a box is linked to four or more boxes

      • sortStagesByNumLinks

        private MechStage sortStagesByNumLinks(List<MechStage> oneLinkStages)
                                throws MechError
        Sorts the stages by the number of links they have to other stages, storing one-link stages in oneLinkStages and returning a three-link stage.
        Parameters:
        oneLinkStages - empty when passed; stores the stages with one link
        Returns:
        a stage that has three links, or null if none found
        Throws:
        MechError - if stages aren't linked correctly

      • findFirstStage

        private void findFirstStage(MechStage threeLinksStage)
                     throws MechError
        Finds the first stage when there are no stages with one link to other stages.
        Parameters:
        threeLinksStage - a stage linked to three other stages
        Throws:
        MechError - if a stage has three links, or if the first stage could not be identified

      • findFirstStage

        private void findFirstStage(MechStage firstStage,
                            MechStage threeLinksStage)
                     throws MechError
        Finds the first stage when there is one stage with one link to other stages.
        Parameters:
        firstStage - the only stage linked to one other stage
        threeLinksStage - a stage linked to three other stages
        Throws:
        MechError - if there is no stage with three links

      • findFirstStage

        private void findFirstStage(List<MechStage> oneLinkStages,
                            MechStage threeLinksStage)
                     throws MechError
        Finds the first stage when there are two stages with one link to other stages.
        Parameters:
        oneLinkStages - the two stages linked to one other stage
        threeLinksStage - a stage linked to three other stages
        Throws:
        MechError - if a stage has three links, or if the first stage could not be identified

      • findFirstStage

        private void findFirstStage(List<MechStage> oneLinkStages)
                     throws MechError
        Finds the first stage when there are two stages with one link to other stages.
        Parameters:
        oneLinkStages - the two stages linked to one other stage
        Throws:
        MechError - if the first stage could not be identified

      • checkLastStageForFlows

        private void checkLastStageForFlows()
                             throws MechError
        Checks whether the last stage of this linear mechanism has electron-flow arrows.
        Throws:
        MechError - if the last stage has electron-flow arrows

      • failFindFirstStage

        private void failFindFirstStage(List<MechStage> oneLinkStages)
                         throws MechError
        Throws an error because there are three or more stages with one link to other stages.
        Parameters:
        oneLinkStages - all stages linked to one other stage
        Throws:
        MechError - always

      • getPoint

        private MPoint getPoint(MPolyline line,
                        int kind)
        Gets a point of an MPolyline.
        Parameters:
        line - the MPolyline
        kind - head, tail, midpoint
        Returns:
        one of the MPolyline's points

      • copyStageContents

        private void copyStageContents(int sourceStageNum,
                               int destStageNum)
        Copies the contents of one stage into another.
        Parameters:
        sourceStageNum - index of stage whose contents will be copied
        destStageNum - index of stage accepting the contents

      • redirectResArrow

        private void redirectResArrow(MechArrow arrow,
                              List<MechStage> newStages,
                              int stageNum)
        Decides whether a resonance arrow's prevStage and nextStage are correct or should be switched. Utility method for reorderStages().
        Parameters:
        arrow - the resonance arrow
        newStages - stages that have already been ordered
        stageNum - index of current stage in physical list

      • fail

        private void fail(String message)
           throws MechError
        Throws a MechError of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        message - message to store in the MechError
        Throws:
        MechError - contains information on what went wrong

      • fail

        private void fail(String message,
                  String variablePart)
           throws MechError
        Throws a MechError of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        message - message to store in the MechError
        variablePart - a string to substitute for part of the message
        Throws:
        MechError - contains information on what went wrong

      • fail

        private void fail(int objIndex,
                  String message)
           throws MechError
        Creates a modified response with the indicated MObject colored, throws a MechError of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        objIndex - 0-based index of an object to highlight
        message - message to store in the MechError
        Throws:
        MechError - contains information on what went wrong

      • fail

        private void fail(int objIndex1,
                  int objIndex2,
                  String message)
           throws MechError
        Creates a modified response with the indicated MObjects colored, throws a MechError of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        objIndex1 - objIndex in the MDocument of the response of first object to be colored
        objIndex2 - objIndex in the MDocument of the response of second object to be colored
        message - error message for student
        Throws:
        MechError - always

      • fail

        private void fail(int[] objIndices,
                  String message)
           throws MechError
        Creates a modified response with the indicated MObjects colored, throws a MechError of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        objIndices - indices in the MDocument of the response of objects to be colored
        message - error message for student
        Throws:
        MechError - always

      • failAtomIn2

        private void failAtomIn2(MolAtom atom)
                  throws MechError
        A parsing error occurred because an atom was in two boxes. Throws a MechError of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        atom - atom that was in two boxes
        Throws:
        MechError - contains information on what went wrong

      • failAtomOutside

        private void failAtomOutside(MolAtom atom,
                             int atomIndex,
                             Molecule mol)
                      throws MechError
        A parsing error occurred because an atom was outside any box. Throws a MechError of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        atom - atom that was outside any box
        atomIndex - the atom's 1-based index
        mol - the molecule containing the atom
        Throws:
        MechError - contains information on what went wrong
